comments.content: Those are some very closed apertures. Do you worry about C/O, c/o, a/e/s being difficult to distinguish?

<cite>Those are some very closed apertures. Do you worry about C/O, c/o, a/e/s being difficult to distinguish?</cite>

Don’t overthink things. Nobody is going to use this typeface for road signs around international airports. Display type that takes an extra tenth of a second to read is not a bad thing—people read all-caps fraktur, don’t they?
Nice work Tomi. How many fonts are you working on?!

<cite>people read all-caps fraktur, don’t they?</cite>

Not if they have a choice! ;-)
